Here's your translation to English of the song. Being a native Spanish speaker, I might have lacked some good American Slang words for a more accurate translation, but I think I did it well enough. If you know some Spanish, you'll see that I did not a literal translation. For example "gata" is literally a female cat, but in this context it is the Puerto Rican slang word translatable as "babe". Particularly
"gasolina", that literally "gasoline", here means alcohol, most likely rum, or maybe also drugs in general.

I got the Spanish version from metrolyrics.com/lyrics/671473233/Daddy_Yankee/…, and also used some help from a few Puerto Rican Slang glossaries:
jergasdehablahispana.org/…
lsantos2000.tripod.com/jergas/…
geocities.com/SouthBeach/Castle/1496/…
cai.bc.inter.edu/Ciber-Info/Diccionarios/…

comment_17: ok, this song is not actually about a girl wanting to have sex with him.  it's based on a slang phrase in Puerto Rico.  When a girl likes to drive around a lot, or just in general go out a lot, it's said that she likes gasoline "a esa chica le gusta la gasolina".  This song is about a girl that really likes to drive and hang out and just go out. It just so happens that they go and party together, but the song never says that they have sex or even that they are dating, just partying.

comment_19: the first time the word "duro" is said in the song is right after he says "turn it up (the music) so that the girls can turn on their motors (i.e. dance and party)".  then, he says to prepare for it because what's coming up is something for them, the girls, to hit hard, meaning, for them to dance really hard to. after that, he keeps saying "duro" but it's more like a chant in a song, like other artists will constantly repeat "yeah" or "dale". it's just a word that doesn't have sexual connotations in the song. it means the girls, and really anyone at the club, should really dance to the song, and that the volume should be turned up really high, since in spanish, it's said "pon el volumen bien duro/put the volume really hard".
